metadata.title: CVE-2019-11737 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
If a wildcard ('*') is specified for the host in Content Security Policy(CSP) directives, any port or path restriction of the directive will beignored, leading to CSP directives not being properly applied to content.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
